intro: Sida macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered mallows, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it often grows in moist, disturbed soils. Sida macrantha is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber.
